<s> Homarus gammarus Homarus gammarus known as the European lobster or common lobster is a species of unk lobster from the eastern Atlantic Ocean Mediterranean Sea and parts of the Black Sea </s>
<s> It is closely related to the American lobster H americanus </s>
<s> It may grow to a length of cm in and a mass of kilograms lb and bears a conspicuous pair of claws </s>
<s> In life the lobsters are blue only becoming lobster red on cooking </s>
<s> Mating occurs in the summer producing eggs which are carried by the females for up to a year before hatching into unk larvae </s>
<s> Homarus gammarus is a highly esteemed food and is widely caught using lobster pots mostly around the British Isles </s>
<s> Description Homarus gammarus is a large unk with a body length up to centimetres in and weighing up to kilograms lb although the lobsters caught in lobster pots are usually cm in long and weigh </s>
<s>  </s>
<s> kg </s>
<s>  </s>
<s> lb </s>
<s> Like other crustaceans lobsters have a hard unk which they must shed in order to grow in a process called unk unk </s>
<s> This may occur several times a year for young lobsters but decreases to once every years for larger animals </s>
<s> The first pair of unk is armed with a large asymmetrical pair of claws </s>
<s> The larger one is the unk and has rounded unk used for crushing prey the other is the cutter which has sharp inner edges and is used for holding or tearing the prey </s>
<s> Usually the left claw is the unk and the right is the cutter </s>
<s> The unk is generally blue above with spots that unk and yellow below </s>
<s> The red colour associated with lobsters only appears after cooking </s>
<s> This occurs because in life the red pigment unk is bound to a protein complex but the complex is broken up by the heat of cooking releasing the red pigment </s>
<s> The closest relative of H gammarus is the American lobster Homarus americanus </s>
<s> The two species are very similar and can be crossed artificially although hybrids are unlikely to occur in the wild since their ranges do not overlap </s>
<s> The two species can be distinguished by a number of characteristics The unk of H americanus bears one or more spines on the underside which are lacking in H gammarus </s>
<s> The spines on the claws of H americanus are red or red tipped while those of H gammarus are white or white tipped </s>
<s> The underside of the claw of H americanus is orange or red while that of H gammarus is creamy white or very pale red </s>
<s> Life cycle Female H gammarus reach sexual maturity when they have grown to a carapace length of millimetres </s>
<s>  </s>
<s> in whereas males mature at a slightly smaller size </s>
<s> Mating typically occurs in summer between a recently unk female whose shell is therefore soft and a hard shelled male </s>
<s> The female carries the eggs for up to months depending on the temperature attached to her unk </s>
<s> Females carrying eggs are said to be unk and can be found throughout the year </s>
<s> The eggs hatch at night and the larvae swim to the water surface where they drift with the ocean currents preying on unk </s>
<s> This stage involves three unk and lasts for days </s>
<s> After the third moult the juvenile takes on a form closer to the adult and adopts a unk lifestyle </s>
<s> The juveniles are rarely seen in the wild and are poorly known although they are known to be capable of digging extensive burrows </s>
<s> It is estimated that only larva in every survives to the unk phase </s>
<s> When they reach a carapace length of mm </s>
<s> in the juveniles leave their burrows and start their adult lives </s>
<s> Distribution Homarus gammarus is found across the north eastern Atlantic Ocean from northern Norway to the Azores and Morocco not including the Baltic Sea </s>
<s> It is also present in most of the Mediterranean Sea only missing from the section east of Crete and along only the north west coast of the Black Sea </s>
<s> The unk populations are found in the Norwegian unk unk and unk inside the Arctic Circle </s>
<s> The species can be divided into four genetically distinct populations one widespread population and three which have diverged due to small effective population sizes possibly due to adaptation to the local environment </s>
<s> The first of these is the population of lobsters from northern Norway which have been referred to as the midnight sun lobster </s>
<s> The populations in the Mediterranean Sea are distinct from those in the Atlantic Ocean </s>
<s> The last distinct population is found in the Netherlands samples from the unk were distinct from those collected in the North Sea or English Channel </s>
<s> Attempts have been made to introduce H gammarus to New Zealand alongside other European species such as the edible crab Cancer unk </s>
<s> Between and one million lobster larvae were released from unk in unk but the species did not become established there </s>
<s> Ecology Adult H gammarus live on the continental shelf at depths of metres unk ft although not normally deeper than m ft </s>
<s> They prefer hard substrates such as rocks or hard mud and live in holes or crevices emerging at night to feed </s>
<s> The diet of H gammarus mostly consists of other unk invertebrates </s>
<s> These include crabs molluscs sea unk unk and polychaete worms </s>
<s> The three unk lobster species Homarus gammarus H americanus and unk unk are hosts to the three known species of the animal unk unk the species on H gammarus has not been described </s>
<s> Homarus gammarus is susceptible to the disease unk caused by the unk unk unk </s>
<s> Although it is frequently found in American lobsters the disease has only been seen in captive H gammarus where prior occupation of the tanks by H americanus could not be ruled out </s>
<s> Human consumption Homarus gammarus is traditionally highly esteemed as a unk and was mentioned in The unk a seventeenth century English folk song </s>
<s> It may fetch very high prices and may be sold fresh frozen canned or powdered </s>
<s> Both the claws and the abdomen of H gammarus contain excellent white meat and most of the contents of the cephalothorax are edible </s>
<s> The exceptions are the unk mill and the sand vein gut </s>
<s> The price of H gammarus is up to three times higher than that of H americanus and the European species is considered to have a better flavour </s>
<s> unk are mostly fished using lobster pots although lines unk with unk or unk sometimes succeed in tempting them out to allow them to be caught in a net or by hand </s>
<s> In t of H gammarus were caught across Europe and North Africa of which t was caught in the British Isles including the Channel Islands </s>
<s> The minimum landing size for H gammarus is a carapace length of mm </s>
<s> in </s>
<s> unk systems for H gammarus are under development and production rates are still very low </s>
<s> unk history Homarus gammarus was first given a binomial name by Carl Linnaeus in the tenth edition of his Systema unk published in </s>
<s> That name was Cancer gammarus since Linnaeus concept of the genus Cancer at that time included all large crustaceans </s>
<s> H gammarus is the type species of the genus Homarus Weber as determined by Direction of the International Commission on Zoological Nomenclature </s>
<s> Prior to that direction confusion arose because the species had been referred to by several different names including unk unk unk and Homarus vulgaris H Milne Edwards and also because Friedrich Weber s description of the genus had been overlooked until rediscovered by Mary unk rendering any prior assignments of type species for Homarus H Milne Edwards invalid for Homarus Weber </s>
<s> The type specimen of Homarus gammarus was a unk selected by unk unk in </s>
<s> It came from N E near unk Sweden kilometres or miles northwest of Gothenburg but both it and the unk have since been lost </s>
<s> The common name for H gammarus preferred by the Food and Agriculture Organization is European lobster but the species is also widely known as the common lobster </s>

<s> M Michigan highway M is a state trunkline in the Lower Peninsula in the US state of Michigan that travels between unk and Howard City </s>
<s> The section between unk and Howard City travels through unk and along the southern edge of unk National Forest </s>
<s> The current version of M is actually the second in the state the first usage appeared in the Upper Peninsula by </s>

<s> M forms the north south unk unk and unk unk county lines </s>

<s> The highway rounds a curve and transitions to Street running eastward through more farm land </s>
<s> As the trunkline approaches unk the terrain becomes more wooded near the unk River </s>
<s> M follows unk Street east to a junction with M </s>
<s> The two highways merge and run concurrently over the river and into downtown on State Street </s>
<s> South of downtown M turns east again independent of M and runs along Street on the southern edge of the unk National Forest </s>
<s> The east end of M is at exit on US M west of Howard City </s>
<s> The Michigan Department of Transportation MDOT as a part of its maintenance responsibilities tracks the volume of traffic using its roadways </s>
<s> These levels are expressed in terms of a metric called average annual daily traffic AADT which is a calculation of the traffic along a segment of road for any average day of the year </s>

<s> Meridian Mississippi Meridian is the sixth largest city in the state of Mississippi in the United States </s>
<s> It is the county seat of Lauderdale County and the principal city of the Meridian Mississippi unk Statistical Area </s>

<s> History Previously inhabited by the unk Native Americans the area now called Meridian was obtained by the United States under the terms of the Treaty of Dancing unk Creek in during the period of Indian unk </s>

<s>  </s>
<s> unk and Ball now known as the founders of the city began laying out lots for new development on their respective land sections </s>
<s> There was much competition over the proposed name of the settlement </s>

<s> Meridian was a small village at the start of the American Civil War in </s>

<s> Culture Arts Known for more than a century of arts Meridian contains many art and cultural organizations and hosts many cultural events </s>

<s> Art exhibitions were originally held in Lamar Hotel in downtown Meridian but after a name change to Meridian Art Association in exhibitions were held at various locations around the city </s>
<s> After the Carnegie library at unk and St was closed the Art Association remodelled the building into the Meridian Museum of Art to serve as a permanent home for exhibits </s>

<s> Angel of Death Slayer song Angel of Death is the opening track on the American thrash metal band Slayer s album Reign in Blood </s>
<s> The lyrics and music were written by Slayer guitarist Jeff Hanneman and are based on Nazi physician unk unk who conducted human experiments at the Auschwitz concentration camp during World War II </s>
<s> Angel of Death led to the band facing accusations of Nazi unk and racism throughout their career </s>
<s> Despite the controversy surrounding the song and its contribution to the delay in the release of Reign in Blood Angel of Death is featured on all of Slayer s live albums and DVDs and has appeared in several movies </s>
<s> The song was well received by critics Steve Huey of AllMusic described it as a classic </s>
<s> Composition and origins Slayer guitarist Jeff Hanneman wrote Angel of Death after reading books about Nazi physician unk unk while on tour with the band I remember stopping unk where I bought two books on unk </s>
<s> I thought This has gotta be some sick shit </s>
<s> So when it came time to do the record that stuff was still in my head that s where the lyrics to Angel of Death came from </s>
<s> The lyrics detail unk s surgical experiments on patients at the Auschwitz concentration camp during World War II </s>
<s> unk s unk were conducted on such groups as dwarfs and twins and included both physical and psychological examinations </s>
<s> Among the tests he performed that are mentioned in Angel of Death are experimental unk performed without anesthesia transfusion of blood between twins isolation endurance unk unk with lethal unk sex change operations the removal of organs and limbs and unk </s>
<s> unk together joining heads </s>
<s> Just a matter of time unk you rip unk apart a line from the penultimate verse is a reference to the allegation unk unk together twins one of them deformed the unk was unk to the other child back to back their wrists back to back too </s>
<s> This claim was first made by Auschwitz survivor unk Alexander at the trial of SS unk Adolf unk the architect of the Holocaust where it was asserted that unk unk the veins together and turned them into unk twins </s>
<s> This allegation became more widely known when unk Alexander was featured in the documentary The Search for unk which has been cited by several authors including Gerald unk an expert on unk </s>
<s> Towards the end of the song there is a line Feeding off the screams of the unk he s creating which was taken from the film The Boys from Brazil in which Dr unk was the villain </s>

<s> Hurricane unk Hurricane unk was a Category hurricane that killed four people after unk the western coast of Mexico in June </s>
<s> unk from an area of disturbed weather on June several hundred miles south of Mexico unk gradually intensified </s>
<s> unk latitude the system became increasingly organized and reached hurricane status on the evening of June </s>
<s> The following morning unk attained winds of mph km h as it passed roughly mi km of Mexico </s>
<s> Due to its interaction with land the hurricane abruptly weakened hours later </s>
<s> Early on June unk dissipated over open waters </s>
<s> Prior to unk s arrival in Mexico hurricane watches and warnings were issued for coastal areas </s>
<s> Hundreds of shelters opened across the states of Colima and Guerrero </s>
<s> Heavy rains from the storm triggered significant flooding along the unk River in Acapulco killing four people </s>
<s> However the overall effects of unk were limited and the rains were largely beneficial in unk a severe drought </s>
<s> Meteorological history On June a trough situated off the southern coast of Guatemala showed signs of possible tropical cyclogenesis </s>
<s> Though located within an area favoring development the system remained broad and disorganized as it moved slowly west northwestward </s>
<s> Gradually convection consolidated around an area of low pressure </s>
<s> On June a Tropical Cyclone Formation unk was issued for the system as it was expected to develop into a tropical depression within hours </s>
<s> On the following day the low further developed and was declared Tropical Depression Two E by the National Hurricane Center at UTC </s>
<s> Upon being declared the depression was located about unk mi km south southeast of unk unk Mexico </s>
<s> However after post analysis the depression had actually developed nine hours earlier </s>
<s> unk a west northwesterly track in response to a subtropical ridge to the north the depression was forecast to move into a favorable environment characterized by low wind shear and sea surface temperatures up to F C </s>
<s> Three hours after classification the depression strengthened Tropical Storm unk the second named storm of the season </s>
<s> Early on June convection increased markedly with several unk tops denoted by cloud top temperatures below C F appearing on satellite imagery </s>
<s> A notable increase in unk outflow also took place </s>
<s> As the subtropical ridge north of the storm weakened unk acquired a more northerly component to its track bringing the center of the storm closer to Mexico </s>
<s> unk bands gradually wrapped around the system throughout the day </s>
<s> During the afternoon hours of June a hurricane hunter aircraft found unk just below hurricane strength and subsequently the system was upgraded just a few hours later while situated roughly mi km southeast of Manzanillo Mexico </s>
<s> Early on June a to mi to km wide eye developed within the central dense unk </s>
<s> In light of this the National Hurricane Center estimated unk to have attained winds of mph km h along with a barometric pressure of mbar hPa </s>
<s> inHg however it was noted that this could be conservative based on estimates of mph km h from the University of Wisconsin and the unk Analysis Branch </s>
<s> Throughout the morning of June unk brushed the coast of Mexico with the center passing roughly mi km south southeast of La Fortuna Mexico </s>
<s> unk just off the coast of Mexico the system interacted with land and began weakening </s>
<s> unk later convection rapidly diminished as dry air became entrained in the circulation </s>
<s> In response to quick degradation of the system s structure the NHC downgraded unk to a tropical storm </s>
<s> Rapid weakening continued throughout the day and by the evening hours the storm no longer had a defined circulation </s>
<s> Lacking an organized center and deep convection the final advisory was issued on unk </s>
<s> The storm s remnants persisted for several more hours before dissipating roughly mi km southwest of Cabo Corrientes Mexico </s>
<s> Preparations and impact Following the classification of Tropical Depression Two E on June the Government of Mexico issued a tropical storm warning for coastal areas between unk and Manzanillo </s>
<s> A hurricane watch was also put in place from unk de unk to Punta San unk </s>
<s> Later that day the tropical storm warning was upgraded to a hurricane warning and the watch was extended westward to La Fortuna </s>
<s> As unk continued to strengthen the watches and warnings were extended westward to Cabo Corrientes on June </s>
<s> Early on June the easternmost advisories were discontinued as unk moved away </s>
<s> Later that morning all watches and warnings were discontinued in light of unk s rapid weakening </s>
<s> In Colima and unk residents were warned of heavy rains that could trigger flooding and mudslides </s>
<s> Schools across both states canceled classes for June </s>
<s> In Colima shelters were opened to the public </s>
<s> Additionally the Mexican Navy was placed on standby for hurricane relief </s>
<s> A total of temporary shelters were opened in Guerrero many of which were in Acapulco as many residents were expected to evacuate flood prone area </s>
<s> An orange level alert was issued for portions of Chiapas in light of potentially heavy rains </s>
<s> Throughout Western and Southwestern Mexico the unk unk unk National Weather Service advised that all air and sea traffic be suspended until the passage of unk </s>
<s> Across Guerrero unk produced heavy rain peaking at </s>
<s> mm </s>
<s> in in unk Guerrero </s>
<s> Several homes across the state were damaged though none were destroyed </s>
<s> In Acapulco homes were inundated by flood waters prompting unk in areas built in to relocate residents after Hurricane Pauline </s>
<s> Several landslides blocked off roads and a m ft section of a roundabout was destroyed </s>
<s> In the community of unk three people were killed after being washed away by flood waters </s>
<s> Heavy rains from unk caused the unk River to overflow its banks placing homes across unk under water </s>
<s> One person drowned in San Agustín after falling in the swollen river </s>
<s> Twenty seven unk in and around the city lost power after muddy unk entered a unk </s>
<s> Throughout Oaxaca at least a dozen homes lost their roofs due to high winds </s>
<s> unk of Colima Chiapas Michoacán and unk experienced heavy rains however in many areas the rain proved beneficial in unk a severe drought </s>
<s> The unk Blues The unk Blues is a blues song by American folk and blues musician Lead unk </s>
<s> It was written in June in response to the discrimination and segregation that Lead unk faced during a visit to Washington DC to record for Alan unk </s>
<s> It rails against racism the Jim Crow laws and the conditions of contemporary African Americans in the southern United States </s>
<s> The song was recorded in December for the Library of Congress and re recorded in for commercial release </s>
<s> It has been remixed and covered by a number of artists including Pete Seeger unk unk Hans unk and Billy Bragg </s>
<s> The unk Blues is regarded as one of Lead unk s best original works but it also drew controversy </s>
<s> There is doubt over the song s authorship with some scholars unk that Lead unk was unlikely to have written a work in a genre new to him without a collaborator </s>
<s> unk have been raised over his role in the American Communist Party and whether he and the song were used to further the party s political goals </s>
<s> Background and creation Most music historians date the writing of The unk Blues to Lead unk s June trip to Washington DC when he was invited by the unk Alan unk to record for the Library of Congress s folk music collection </s>
<s> On the first night Lead unk and his wife Martha spent in the city they encountered racially unk Jim Crow laws similar to those found in their native Louisiana most hotels refused to rent rooms to African Americans and the few that would were either full or refused to serve him because he was with a white man unk </s>
<s> unk in some versions of the story described as an unnamed white friend offered to let the couple stay for the night in his apartment near the Supreme Court Building </s>
<s> The next morning Lead unk unk to unk arguing with his unk about the presence of a black man with the unk threatening to call the police </s>
<s> While in Washington Lead unk encountered several other incidents of segregation that are believed to have contributed to the unk of the song </s>
<s> For instance when Lead unk unk and their wives wanted to go out to dinner together they discovered that it was impossible for the mixed race group to find a restaurant that would serve them </s>
<s> Lead unk was told that if he returned later without unk he would be served </s>
<s> In response to one of these incidents a friend of Lead unk s variously identified as either unk or Mary Elizabeth unk joked that Washington was a unk town </s>
<s> Though Lead unk did not know what the word unk meant he was fascinated by the sound of it and after its meaning was explained to him he decided to incorporate it into a song about the trip </s>
<s> The song came together quickly one account claims that it only took a few hours for Lead unk to write it </s>
<s> unk liked it because it was partly based on what happened in his apartment </s>
<s> Lyrics themes and music The unk Blues is a blues style protest song that criticizes the culture of Washington DC </s>
<s> It protests against both the city s Jim Crow laws and the racism of its white population </s>
<s> Its structure includes several verses and a refrain that declares that the speaker is going to spread the news all around about the racial issues unk the city </s>
<s> The song particularly in the refrain unk race and economics by referring to unk as unk </s>
<s> The first two verses speak of the segregation that Lead unk encountered in Washington DC the first recounts the fact that during the trip Lead unk was turned down wherever he tried to get served due to his race while the second recounts the argument between unk and his unk over Lead unk staying in his apartment </s>
<s> The third verse unk cites the home of the brave the land of the Free juxtaposed with the mistreatment he received at the hands of white people in Washington DC </s>
<s> The fourth verse speaks of the racism of the white population of the city leading to the song s end which suggests that African Americans boycott buying homes in the district </s>
<s> The song s tone implies that the speaker feels powerless against the discrimination and racism that he encounters despite this by spreading the news of his poor treatment in a song the speaker uses what power he has to tell both southern African Americans and northern whites that the status unk is deeply flawed and that something needs to change </s>
<s> The unk Blues follows a traditional twelve bar blues format </s>
<s> It is written in time but unk to note that the song unk should swing at medium unk </s>
<s> The song was written in B </s>
<s> It uses twelve measures with verses one to four repeating followed by the final two verses and a unk </s>
<s> Recordings and unk Lead unk first recorded The unk Blues in December in New York City for donation to the Library of Congress </s>
<s> He re recorded the song in April for unk Records for release the same year as a rpm record </s>
<s> The version that was commercially released features Lead unk singing and playing the twelve string guitar without any other accompaniment </s>
<s> The song has been covered and unk by a variety of artists including Pete Seeger and Hans unk </s>
<s> Seeger recorded and released both live and studio versions of the song on several of his albums </s>
<s> In Australia the song was reworked as Canberra Blues by The unk unk an R B band </s>
<s> The lyrics speak of the problems faced by young Australians in the Australian Capital Territory in the </s>
<s> unk adapted the song to his style of European blues for the album Journey On in </s>
<s> In Billy Bragg reworked the song as Bush War Blues </s>
<s> Bragg s cover is a topical protest song about the Iraq War </s>
<s> In one verse Bragg claims that the Iraq War was not for democracy but instead was to make the world safe for unk </s>
<s> In another he takes on the Christian right asking where the unk are </s>
<s> Finally Bragg unk the United States government for not dealing with poverty at home before going to war </s>
<s> Legacy The unk Blues is one of Lead unk s most famous songs and is remembered as his most heartfelt protest song </s>
<s> There is disagreement among music scholars as to its importance </s>
<s> Robert unk claims that the song is peripheral to the wider study of the blues while Lawson points to it as a watershed in the way African Americans see themselves in the fabric of the United States </s>
<s> There is debate over the relationship between the song and radical politics </s>
<s> After its release it became popular with left wing political groups </s>
<s> Lead unk was invited to perform at Camp Unity the Communist Party USA s summer retreat and the FBI subsequently opened a file on him in the </s>
<s> This led to the accusations that the Communists were taking advantage of him and using him as a platform </s>
<s> The party claims to the contrary that they were some of the few people who respected him and gave him a chance to perform </s>
<s> Jeff Todd unk and several other writers have suggested that Lead unk had significant help with its authorship and claim it is not a genuine protest song </s>
<s> This theory stems from the idea that Lead unk did not have a history of protest music before he was discovered by unk </s>
<s> Since the music that unk recorded was sold to unk sympathetic to Civil Rights it has been suggested that unk helped him write a song attractive to a white audience </s>
<s> Lead unk admitted that the term unk was unfamiliar to him and it seems out of place compared to the vocabulary of his past work </s>

<s> Track listings and formats Credits and personnel Madonna Lead vocals producer Stuart Price Producer Neil Tennant Supporting vocals Guy unk Management unk unk Mixing Giovanni Bianco Graphic Design Art Direction Orlando unk unk A R Angela Becker Management Ian Green Programming Producer Paul unk unk Pete unk Programming Steven Klein unk Pet Shop Boys unk Producer unk Charts Certifications High Five Interchange The High Five Interchange is one of the first five level stack interchanges built in Dallas Texas </s>
<s> Located at the junction of the Lyndon B Johnson Freeway Interstate I and the Central Expressway US Highway US it replaces an unk partial cloverleaf interchange constructed in the </s>
<s> The million project was started in and completed in December </s>
<s> It was designed by the unk Corporation and built by unk Construction Corporation </s>
<s> The interchange is considered by Popular unk to be one of The World s unk unk because of its height as high as a story building its permanent bridges and other unusual design and construction features </s>
<s> In the American Public Works Association named the High Five Interchange as Public Works unk of the Year </s>
<s> Description The High Five Interchange north of downtown in Dallas Texas is a massive five level freeway interchange </s>
<s> It is the junction of two major highways carrying heavy rush hour traffic the Lyndon B Johnson Freeway Interstate and the Central Expressway US and is the first five level stack interchange to be built in the city </s>
<s> It replaces the unk three level modified cloverleaf interchange built in the that caused a severe bottleneck by narrowing US down to two lanes at the junction of the two highways </s>
<s> The looped ramps of the cloverleaf forced motorists to slow down drastically backing up traffic </s>
<s> Left hand exits contributed to the congestion </s>
<s> Further its two frontage roads were not directly connected to each other making local access difficult </s>
<s> unk to the celebratory gesture the High Five name refers to the five flyover ramps handling the left turn movements that tower over the landscape </s>
<s> The interchange is as high as a story building and includes bridges spread across five levels the High Five support tiers and miles of additional highway </s>
<s> The highest ramps are feet m above ground </s>
<s> The lanes of US which are on the bottom level are feet m below ground level giving the structure a total height of feet from bottom to top As part of the project I was widened to include four dedicated high occupancy vehicle lanes unk lanes that are barrier separated and unk </s>
<s> The roads on the five levels are Level I US an eight lane highway four lanes going each way Level II The junction of the two six lane frontage roads each having three through lanes in each direction left turn lanes and unk and easy access to US and I Level III I ten regular lanes five going each way and four unk lanes two going each way separated by barriers Level IV and V Direct connection ramps two levels eliminating the left exits of the modified cloverleaf The interchange with its decorative unk on unk concrete elements along with the visually appealing coloration specified by the Texas Department of Transportation unk can be regarded as an enormous work of public art </s>
<s> The High Five also incorporates a hiking and bike trail named the unk Trail which runs under all levels of the interchange </s>
<s> The section of the trail passing beneath the interchange was constructed as part of the High Five project by unk </s>
<s> The interchange is considered by Popular unk as one of The World s unk unk calling it a labyrinth of lanes and a five level unk of engineering because of its height the number of its bridges and other unusual design and construction features </s>
<s> History The High Five Interchange project was planned as a replacement for the existing unk interchange that accommodated vehicles daily and was located in one of the most intensely developed commercial zones in Dallas </s>
<s> It was a collaborative project between the unk affected motorists and property owners and the primary contractor unk Construction </s>
<s> An essential consideration was to complete the project with as little disruption to the traffic flow as possible </s>
<s> Reasons for upgrading the interchange in addition to the need to increase traffic flow and reduce congestion were to improve air quality safety and local access </s>
<s> unk Construction Corporation submitted the lowest bid and was awarded the million contract by unk the largest ever by that agency </s>
<s> The construction contract for the High Five Interchange was unique in that it contained elements not found in other construction project contracts </s>
<s> For example it specified the concrete maturity method to be used to ensure the concrete s strength the first time unk had ever done so and contained an early completion bonus a unk scale of up to million if the company completed the contract within four years </s>
<s> Also built into the construction contract was a provision that unk was charged for lane rentals by unk for time they closed down traffic lanes fees based on unk assessments and the time of day the lane was closed </s>
<s> The fees ranged from to a high of for rush hours </s>
<s> In order not to interfere with traffic flow during construction the new interchange was designed largely as elevated flyover ramps and unk so they could be built high over the existing junction lanes once traffic was transferred to the new structures the old lanes could simply be closed off and removed </s>
<s> Little of the original interchange remained when the project was finished </s>
<s> To save time and money innovative construction methods were employed The original plans called for the segments of the long ramps and spans used to direct connect roads to be made of steel but because building with steel would interfere with heavy traffic flow during construction cast in place segmental concrete was substituted in the plans </s>
<s> However unk decided to use unk concrete segmental bridges rather than casting the bridge elements in place and used a unique machine designed and constructed by Deal unk of Italy and costing about million to move the pieces into place </s>
<s> During the construction </s>
<s> million cubic yards of unk was used cubic yards of concrete was mixed on site and square feet of retaining walls were built </s>
<s> Additionally feet of drilled shafts and linear feet of drainage pipe were completed </s>
<s> In addition to the construction of permanent bridges six temporary bridges were built resulting in </s>
<s> million square feet of bridge deck </s>
<s> The project was designed by the unk Corporation who provided professional engineering consultation throughout the construction which had begun in and was completed in December more than months sooner than planned </s>
<s> Awards In the American Public Works Association named the High Five Public Works Project of the Year for its massive size its innovative design the complexity and unk of its construction and the need it fulfilled for the community </s>
<s> unk as the managing agency unk Construction Corporation as the primary contractor and unk Corporation as the primary consultant received the award in recognition of their cooperative alliance in completing the project </s>
<s> Tim Richmond Tim Richmond June August was an American race car driver from unk Ohio </s>
<s> He competed in unk racing before transferring to unk s Winston Cup Series now unk Cup Series </s>
<s> Richmond was one of the first drivers to change from open wheel racing to unk stock cars full time which has since become an industry trend </s>
<s> He won the Indianapolis Rookie of the Year award and had victories during eight unk seasons </s>
<s> Richmond achieved his top unk season in when he finished third in points </s>

<s> Winston Cup Series unk Busch Series unk Creek Mountains The unk Creek Mountains are a remote semi arid Great Basin mountain range mostly in southeastern Oregon and partially in northern Nevada in the United States </s>
<s> The range s highest point is unk View unk unk feet m above sea level in Nevada </s>
<s> Disaster Peak elevation unk feet m is another prominent summit in the Nevada portion of the mountains </s>
<s> The mountains are characteristic of the Great Basin s topography of mostly parallel mountain ranges alternating with flat valleys </s>
<s> unk generally north to south the unk Creek Mountains consist primarily of fault blocks of basalt which came from an ancient volcano and other unk on top of older unk rocks </s>
<s> The southern end of the range however features many unk unk </s>
<s> As a whole the faulted terrain is dominated by rolling hills and ridges cut by unk and canyons </s>
<s> Most of the range is public land administered by the federal Bureau of Land Management </s>
<s> There is very little human development in the remote region cattle grazing and unk are the primary human uses but former mines at the unk unk produced some of the largest amounts of mercury in North America in the century </s>
<s> Public lands in the mountains are open to recreation but are rarely visited </s>
<s> unk includes large unk of big sagebrush in addition to desert grasses and cottonwood and alder stands </s>
<s> Sage grouse and mountain unk are two bird species native to the range and common mammals include unk and jackrabbits </s>
<s> Despite the area s dry climate a few year round streams provide habitat for the rare unk unk trout </s>
<s> Fish populations in the unk Creek Mountains declined throughout much of the century </s>
<s> In the the effects of grazing unk on riparian zones and the fish led to land use conflict </s>
<s> The unk Creek Mountain Working Group was formed in to help resolve disagreements among livestock owners environmentalists government agencies and other interested parties </s>
<s> The unk met and agreed on changes to land use practices and since the early riparian zones have begun to recover </s>
<s> Geography The unk Creek Mountains are in a very remote area of southeastern Oregon and northern Nevada in Harney and Humboldt counties </s>
<s> The nearest human settlements are the unk Ranch about miles km directly north from the middle of the mountains Fields Oregon about miles km to the northwest unk Nevada about miles km to the west and unk Nevada Oregon about miles km to the east </s>
<s> The mountains are about miles km directly southwest of Boise Idaho and about miles km northeast of unk Nevada </s>
<s> The range and surrounding non mountainous areas cover an area of unk square miles </s>
<s> The mountains run miles km north to south and miles km east to west </s>
<s> More of the range is in Oregon than in Nevada </s>
<s> The highest point in the range is unk View unk which is unk feet m above sea level and is located in Nevada about one mile south of the Oregon border </s>
<s> About two miles southeast of unk View is Disaster Peak a large symmetrical unk that is visible throughout the region </s>
<s> At unk feet m Disaster Peak anchors the southern end of the mountains in a sub range called The unk </s>
<s> The Oregon Canyon Mountains border the unk Creek Mountains on the east along the Harney unk county line according to the United States Geological Survey s definitions while the unk Mountains are the next range west of the unk Creek Mountains </s>
<s> The unk Creek Mountains in both Oregon and Nevada border the unk Creek Mountains on the southwest the two ranges are separated by unk Cabin Creek and South Fork unk Creek </s>
<s> South of the unk Creek Mountains is the Kings River Valley which separates the unk Creek Mountains on the west from the Montana Mountains on the east </s>
<s> The terrain in the unk Creek Mountains varies from broad flat basins and rolling ridges to high rock unk cut by deep canyons </s>
<s> The canyons have steep walls with loose unk slopes at the unk </s>
<s> There are meadows around springs in the mountains although most streams in the range do not flow year round </s>
<s> Major streams that flow off the north slopes of the mountains include from west to east unk Creek unk Creek unk Creek and unk Creek </s>
<s> These streams all flow into unk basins in Harney County Oregon </s>
<s> unk Creek and unk Creek are the largest of the four </s>
<s> The Kings River and unk Creek each drain an area on the south slopes of the unk Creek Mountains </s>
<s> The Kings River begins in The unk and flows south into Nevada where it meets the Quinn River which unk in the Black Rock Desert </s>
<s> unk Creek begins in Oregon a few miles north of The unk and flows generally east crossing the Oregon Nevada border five times before disappearing into the floor of the Quinn River Valley south of unk </s>
<s> Geology The mountains lie within the Basin and Range Province or Great Basin of the Western United States which is characterized by a series of parallel fault blocks that form long north south mountain ranges separated by wide high desert valleys </s>
<s> The unk Creek Mountains are unk and unk blocks with steep unk along the southern and eastern sides of the range </s>
<s> The southern area of the range known as The unk has numerous unk of Cretaceous age granite </s>
<s> These granite unk are commonly found in the eroded valleys below the volcanic unk </s>
<s> The unk Creek Mountains are composed mostly of basalt from a shield volcano that once stood where unk Mountain is today </s>
<s> unk thinning and the Yellowstone unk which was then beneath southeastern Oregon induced eruptions from unk and nearby unk about million years ago in the Miocene </s>
<s> The unk produced a series of unk flows that spread across the land now known as the unk Creek Mountains </s>
<s> unk from the unk volcano lasted for about one million years and at least separate unk flows occurred </s>
<s> Under the resulting basalt rock lie much older unk rocks that may be related to some of the unk age formations of the Blue Mountains in northeastern Oregon </s>
<s> Within these unk rocks are unk and unk unk bodies which were presumably unk during the Cretaceous Period </s>
<s> The broad unk unk is a prominent geologic feature in the unk Creek Mountains </s>
<s> The oval shaped unk is a collapsed unk dome that unk the Oregon Nevada border on the eastern side of the range and south of the Oregon Canyon Mountains </s>
<s> It is about miles km long and miles km wide </s>
<s> The unk dome was created by volcanic eruptions in the early Miocene </s>
<s> A total of five large ash flows were produced along with a large unk dome structure </s>
<s> The unk formed when the dome collapsed about million years ago </s>
<s> The unk contains significant ore deposits and mercury and uranium have been mined at eight or more sites in and around the unk </s>
<s> Other areas in the unk were mined for ores of antimony unk and lithium </s>
<s> Climate The unk Creek Mountains are semi arid because they are in the eastern rain shadow of mountain ranges to the west </s>
<s> When moist air from the Pacific Ocean moves eastward over the Oregon and California coastal ranges and the Cascade Range most precipitation falls in those mountains before reaching the unk Creek Mountains </s>
<s> As a result the average annual precipitation in the unk Creek Mountains is only to inches to mm per year with most areas receiving between and inches and mm annually </s>
<s> Much of the annual precipitation occurs between the beginning of March and the end of June </s>
<s> Most of the rest falls as snow during the fall and winter months </s>
<s> unk at elevations below feet m usually unk by April however at the higher elevations snow can remain until mid June </s>
<s> Local flooding often occurs in the spring as the unk unk </s>
<s> The prevailing winds are from the west southwest and they are normally strongest in March and April </s>
<s> unk intense thunderstorms are common between April and October </s>
<s> unk in the summer months tend to be more isolated and often produce dry lightning strikes </s>
<s> Ecology Flora unk in the unk Creek Mountains is dominated by big sagebrush and desert grasses </s>
<s> Other common shrubs include unk snowberry and unk </s>
<s> There are also patches of mountain mahogany in some areas </s>
<s> Common grass species include Idaho unk bluebunch wheatgrass unk western unk unk s unk unk s unk and unk unk as well as basin unk in some well drained areas </s>
<s> Less than one percent of the range consists of meadow wetlands and riparian unk vegetation along stream banks </s>
<s> However these areas are vital to the local ecosystem </s>
<s> The meadows surround springs which are mostly on gently sloping unk or in stream unk and range in size from about to acres </s>
<s> to </s>
<s> ha </s>
<s> unk riparian unk follow the year round streams </s>
<s> Many unk areas have unk unk and unk groves </s>
<s> unk and alder groves can be found at lower elevations where terrain is unk and stream channels are wider </s>
<s> unk and rushes are also native to these stream unk </s>
<s> Years of heavy livestock grazing in parts of the range resulted in the loss of some grass species riparian vegetation and young unk and unk trees </s>
<s> Restoration of riparian areas began in the early and plans to reduce grazing were implemented in the and early </s>
<s> However large unk in southeastern Oregon during the summer of burned much of the range s vegetation damaging riparian ecosystems and killing hundreds of grazing cattle </s>
<s> Fauna Animals in the unk Creek Mountains are adapted to the environment of the High Desert </s>
<s> unk are common in the open sagebrush covered basins while mule deer live in the cottonwood and unk groves </s>
<s> There are also unk sheep cougars and unk in the high country </s>
<s> Jackrabbits and coyotes are prevalent throughout the range </s>
<s> Mustangs sometimes pass through the mountains as they unk the Great Basin </s>
<s> Some other mammals include the northern pocket unk mountain unk and unk s ground unk </s>
<s> North American unk live in and along streams as do Pacific tree frogs western unk toads and unk snakes </s>
<s> Native bird species include the sage grouse mountain unk gray headed unk black throated gray unk Virginia s unk unk s unk pine unk red unk unk unk thrush northern unk and species of unk and eagle </s>
<s> Several streams in the unk Creek Mountains are home to trout including the rare unk unk trout subspecies </s>
<s> These include unk Creek unk Creek Little unk Creek unk Creek Fifteen Mile Creek Indian Creek Sage Canyon Creek Line Canyon Creek and some tributaries of unk Creek </s>
<s> unk unk trout live in small isolated populations that are often confined to individual streams many of them in the unk Creek Mountains </s>
<s> These populations have significant genetic differences due to their history of isolation </s>
<s> For most of the century the trout s numbers declined considerably </s>
<s> It was listed under federal law as an endangered species in and was reclassified as threatened in </s>
<s> Reasons for the fish s decline included habitat degradation from cattle grazing drought unk competition with other fish and unk with introduced rainbow trout which decreased the number of genetically pure unk unk trout </s>
<s> However reductions in cattle grazing in riparian zones since the allowed fish habitat and populations to start to recover </s>
<s> Human uses The Bureau of Land Management unk administers most land in the unk Creek Mountains but there are also some private lands and some roads in the area </s>
<s> The private lands are mainly used for unk along mountain streams while the unk lands include large grazing unk for local ranchers cattle </s>
<s> At least mining claims in the mountains have been recorded since some of which were staked for gold exploration </s>
<s> Commercial mining has occurred in some areas mostly near the unk unk where uranium and large amounts of mercury have been extracted </s>
<s> unk in what was called the unk unk District produced unk of mercury the richest supply of mercury in the western hemisphere from unk extracted from the unk in the century </s>
<s> The two leading mercury producing mines in North America were the unk and unk mines on the edge of the unk in Nevada </s>
<s> Together they operated from to </s>
<s> The unk Mine the last mercury mine in the United States closed three years later in </s>
<s> However mineral exploration has continued at the unk Mine in the century and waste containing mercury and arsenic was returned there from the community of unk as part of a US Environmental Protection Agency unk project </s>
<s> The entire mountain range is very remote as a result there are few visitors and the range offers a wilderness like experience </s>
<s> unk hunting fishing and hiking are the most popular activities </s>
<s> The only developed recreation site nearby is at unk Creek Hot Springs just south of the unk Ranch where nearby there are miles of trails designated for four wheel off road vehicles </s>
<s> Hunters come to the mountains seeking trophy mule deer unk unk and rabbits </s>
<s> unk on some streams is sometimes permitted on a catch and release basis </s>
<s> The mountains are also suitable for hiking cross country or on game trails in natural corridors along canyons and creek unk </s>
<s> There are more than archaeological sites in the range that document use by Northern unk people as long as years ago </s>
<s> unk grazing in the unk Creek Mountains began in the late century and the unk currently unk grazing unk in the area </s>
<s> unk can be found grazing in some areas during the spring and summer months </s>
<s> The effects of grazing on the local environment were the subject of controversy in the </s>
<s> Land management compromise By the and a century of intense cattle grazing had reduced much of the riparian vegetation along stream banks in the unk Creek Mountains and elsewhere in the Great Basin </s>
<s> As a result stream banks were eroding and upland vegetation was encroaching into riparian zones </s>
<s> unk populations declined as grazing cattle eliminated young trees decreasing shade over streams and raising water temperatures </s>
<s> These conditions put the rare unk unk trout population at risk </s>
<s> Since the unk was officially designated as a threatened species environmental groups began advocating the cancellation of grazing permits in the unk Creek Mountains </s>
<s> Beginning in the early the Bureau of Land Management identified damaged riparian zones and began projects to restore natural habitat in those areas </s>
<s> Approximately unk trees were planted along streams small dams were put together to create more pools in the streams and fencing was added to protect riparian zones from grazing </s>
<s> Next the agency sought to reform land use plans to change grazing practices which became a complex and controversial project </s>
<s> As environmentalists pressed the unk to close much of the unk Creek Mountains to grazing frustrated ranchers joined the unk Rebellion seeking to protect their grazing unk </s>
<s> Initially it appeared that the issue of grazing in the range would produce prolonged litigation with appeals potentially lasting decades </s>
<s> However in interest groups representing all sides of the issue joined to form the unk Creek Mountain Working Group </s>
<s> The group s goal was to find a solution acceptable to everyone a plan that would protect both the land s ecological health and ranchers economic needs </s>
<s> Initial members of the unk Creek Mountain Working Group included Over the next several years the group continued to meet and discuss options for restoring the land while meeting the economic needs of local ranchers </s>
<s> Meetings were all open to the public </s>
<s> The group eventually endorsed a grazing management plan that provided for both the ecological health of sensitive riparian areas and the economic well being of ranchers </s>
<s> In the unk Ranch agreed to rest two grazing unk totaling acres ha to restore critical stream unk and mountain pastures </s>
<s> The unk s unk on Fifteen Mile Creek was rested for three years and its unk Creek pasture received a five year rest before grazing was resumed </s>
<s> In addition the grazing season in mountain pastures was reduced from four months to two and the total number of cattle released in the unk areas was reduced from to </s>
<s> Finally sensitive areas were unk to protect them from cattle and additional water sources were constructed away from streams </s>
<s> Other unk also agreed to rest specific pastures including the unk Creek unk Creek and unk unk unk </s>
<s> In the Bureau of Land Management approved a new grazing unk management plan </s>
<s> It was based on the agreements made by the unk Creek Mountain Working Group and it took effect in </s>
<s> Since then vegetation in riparian areas of the unk Creek Mountains has recovered and studies by the United States Fish and Wildlife Service have found that the unk unk trout population still listed as threatened is also recovering </s>

<s> cm </s>
<s> in in diameter </s>

<s> The gills are pale brown to pinkish and the spore print is white </s>

<s> Habitat and distribution Mycena unk is a saprobic fungus deriving its nutrients from decomposing organic matter found in plant litter such as leaves twigs bark and branches </s>
<s> It unk this by producing enzymes capable of breaking down the three major biochemical components of plant cell walls found in litter unk unk and lignin </s>

<s> Capel unk Capel unk sometimes referred to as Hen unk unk is a ruined chapel near unk unk in Anglesey north Wales dating back to the first half of the century </s>
<s> The chapel s original purpose is unknown but it might have been used as a memorial chapel or in connection with a local royal court or as a chapel of ease in a large parish with a growing population </s>
<s> It was used for a time until the early century as a private place of worship for a nearby house then later fell into disrepair </s>
<s> The walls still remain with some traces of render on them internally but there is no roof </s>
<s> It contains a century side chapel with a vault beneath used as a burial chamber </s>
<s> It is a Grade II listed building a national designation given to buildings of special interest which warrant every effort being made to preserve them in particular because it is a substantially century structure with the unusual century vaulted south chapel </s>
<s> History and location The oldest parts of Capel unk date from the first half of the century </s>
<s> This was a time when many churches on Anglesey in north west Wales were first built in stone following the end of Viking raids and attempts by the unk to gain control of the island </s>
<s> The reason for its construction and the saint to whom it was dedicated are unknown </s>

<s> Despite this it seems to have remained as a chapel of ease rather than become a parish church in its own right </s>
<s> The chapel is sometimes referred to as Hen unk unk hen being the Welsh word for old and unk meaning chapel </s>

<s> After the early part of the century however the chapel became unused and began to fall into disrepair </s>

<s> miles </s>

<s> unk unk b is the innermost known planet in its planetary system </s>
<s> In July the International Astronomical Union launched a process for giving proper names to certain exoplanets and their host stars </s>
<s> The process involved public nomination and voting for the new names </s>
<s> In December the IAU announced the winning name was unk for this planet </s>

<s> Discovery Like the majority of known extrasolar planets unk unk b was detected by the variations in its star s radial velocity caused by the planet s gravity </s>
<s> The variations were detected by making sensitive measurements of the unk shift of unk unk s spectrum </s>
<s> The planet s existence was announced in January together with unk b and the planet orbiting unk unk </s>
<s> Like unk b the first extrasolar planet discovered around a normal star unk unk b orbits very close to its star closer than Mercury does to our Sun </s>
<s> The planet takes </s>
<s> unk days to complete an orbit with a unk axis of </s>
<s> unk AU </s>

<s> MJ </s>
<s> unk is not to be assumed the mutual inclination between c and d is degrees </s>

<s> The unk Space Telescope measured the planet temperature and found that the difference between the two sides of unk unk b of about degrees unk ranging from minus to degrees to about to degrees unk </s>
<s> The temperature difference has led to speculation that unk unk b is unk locked with the same side always facing unk unk A </s>
<s> unk had on the assumption that the planet is similar to Jupiter in composition and that its environment is close to chemical equilibrium predicted unk unk b to have reflective clouds of unk and iron in its upper atmosphere </s>
<s> The cloud deck instead absorbs the sun s radiation between that and the hot high pressure gas surrounding the mantle exists a unk of cooler gas </s>
<s> The outer shell of dark unk hot cloud is assumed to consist of unk and unk oxides unk planets but other compounds like unk cannot be ruled out yet </s>

<s> Filmography Awards and nominations Thirteen Years Later Thirteen Years Later is the fifth episode of the third season of the American crime thriller television series Millennium </s>
<s> It premiered on the Fox network on October </s>
<s> The episode was written by Michael R Perry and directed by Thomas J Wright </s>
<s> Thirteen Years Later featured guest appearances by the members of the band Kiss performing both as themselves and as minor characters </s>
<s> In this episode Federal Bureau of Investigation agents Frank Black Lance unk and Emma Hollis unk Scott investigate a series of murders on the set of a horror film and realize that the production is based on a case Black solved several years earlier </s>
<s> Thirteen Years Later proved a difficult episode to produce with filming requiring a large number of shots to be completed and the script to be adjusted on short notice </s>
<s> It has evoked mixed responses from critics although the guest appearances by the members of Kiss have been more universally criticized </s>
<s> Plot Federal Bureau of Investigation agents Frank Black Lance unk and Emma Hollis unk Scott travel to unk Rest South Carolina to investigate the deaths of film director Lew Carroll Paul Stanley and Marta unk the leading actress in his newest film </s>
<s> As the local sheriff guides Black and Hollis through the murder scene Black realizes that the film is based on a real murder case he investigated thirteen years previously he is shocked to learn that the true story is being unk for the screen </s>
<s> The pair interview the cast and crew as suspects discovering that many would benefit from either of the deaths producer Kenny unk had been having an affair with unk unk unk replaced Carroll as director Ruby Dahl and unk unk whose roles in the film will expand without unk and Mark Bianco a method actor unk the opportunity to meet Black whose role he plays </s>
<s> Also questioned is Hugo Winston the man whose partner was murdered in the earlier case and who is campaigning against what he sees as a unk production </s>
<s> The production continues and after the filming of a pool scene the crew gather in catering unk discovers a severed finger in his sandwich recognizing from its ring that it belonged to unk </s>
<s> When the sheriff unk down production Black unk that the killer may target the crew s hotel he and Hollis arrive to find the body of the film s publicist hanging from a rope </s>
<s> The next day a film extra Gene Simmons confesses to the killings Black unk holes in his story and discovers he is not a credible perpetrator </s>
<s> Regardless production is resumed and shortly afterwards several crew members are found with their unk cut while Winston s body hangs nearby in an apparent murder suicide </s>
<s> Black doubts that Winston is the killer and while Hollis stays in the hotel he visits the production s climactic shoot set during a performance by the band Kiss </s>
<s> As he looks around him the sheriff s body is thrown down from the unk as the unk settles Black realizes that horror films end with the leading lady being targeted the killer is after Hollis </s>
<s> Racing back to her hotel Black discover Hollis unk off a unk wielding Bianco </s>
<s> Black is able to subdue Bianco after Hollis unk the unk the actor then explains that he lacked Black s insight and had to commit the crimes in order to see through the eyes of a killer </s>
<s> Production Thirteen Years Later is the second episode of Millennium to have been written by Michael R Perry who had previously penned the second season episode The unk and would provide a further three scripts in the third season </s>
<s> The episode was directed by Thomas J Wright who helmed a total of twenty six episodes across all three seasons </s>
<s> Wright would also go on to direct Millennium the series crossover episode with its sister show The X Files </s>
<s> The episode features guest appearances by the members of the band Kiss Peter Criss Ace unk Gene Simmons and Paul Stanley who each portray both themselves and a small cameo role </s>
<s> However the band members insisted during filming that their roles be given an equal amount of dialogue which led to Perry being asked to amend scenes on short notice and unk updated scripts to the shooting locations ultimately much of this additional material was filmed but not used in the episode </s>
<s> Ace unk was also unk towards his role and requested to play a pound black man instead wishing to wear a fat suit like those used in the Eddie Murphy film The unk Professor he was eventually convinced that such a suit would take too long to unk </s>
<s> Perry has described the production Thirteen Years Later as being one of the most unk of the series run citing its abundance of stunt work and physical effects as the cause of this </s>
<s> Perry praised Wright for his ability to direct the episode within the usual time constraints as he felt the number of shots involved was more akin to a feature film than a television episode </s>
<s> Guest star Jeff unk who played killer Mark Bianco is the husband of actress Megan Gallagher who starred in the first two seasons of Millennium as Black s wife Catherine </s>

<s> Thirteen Years Later received mixed reviews from critics </s>
<s> The AV </s>
<s> Club s Todd VanDerWerff rated the episode a B </s>
<s> VanDerWerff felt that the episode s comedic unk was necessary within the wider series as he considered Millennium s dark tone to be prone to unintentional comedy and that a comic episode provided an outlet for this </s>
<s> VanDerWerff found the script to be at its strongest when unk the character of Frank Black but admitted that it falls apart when attempting to send up other subjects he also felt that the guest appearance by Kiss felt unnecessary and contrived </s>

<s> New Jersey Route Route is a state highway in the US state of New Jersey </s>
<s> It runs </s>
<s> mi </s>
<s> km from an interchange with Interstate I in Hamilton Township in Mercer County where it continues as I to Route Bridge Street Race Street in Frenchtown unk County </s>
<s> Between the southern terminus and I the route is a mix of freeway and four lane divided highway that runs along the Delaware River through unk </s>
<s> This section includes a truck restricted tunnel that was built along the river near historic houses and unk Cemetery </s>
<s> North of I Route turns into a scenic and mostly two lane highway </s>
<s> North of the South unk Tunnel it is designated the Delaware River Scenic Byway a New Jersey Scenic Byway and National Scenic Byway that follows the Delaware River in mostly rural sections of Mercer County and unk County </s>
<s> The obsolete Delaware unk Canal usually stands between the river and the highway </s>
<s> Most sections of this portion of Route are completely unk due to the tree canopy </s>
<s> Route also has a spur Route which connects Route to US Route US in unk </s>
<s> Route was initially designated in to run from downtown unk to Newark following present day Route and US between unk and unk and US between unk and Newark </s>
<s> The route between unk and Frenchtown was originally Route unk </s>

<s> History The current route was originally legislated in as part of the Delaware River Drive a named state highway that was proposed to run from along the Delaware River from unk to the New York border in unk Township </s>
<s> Route was originally defined in to run from unk to Newark </s>
<s> The original route ran from downtown unk along State Street and unk Drive </s>
<s> From there it followed its current alignment to unk where it followed present day Route to unk to present day County Route unk which it followed to Woods Tavern </s>

<s> Legacy The war was one of several near simultaneous wars unk by the unk Empire and the Yuan dynasty in the late century </s>
<s> Though it was never more than a minor frontier war to the Mongols the war set off a series of enduring developments in Burma </s>
<s> The invasions unk in a period of political fragmentation and the rise of Tai Shan states throughout mainland Southeast Asia </s>
<s> Age of political fragmentation The immediate result of the war was the collapse of the Pagan Empire </s>
<s> However the war merely accelerated the collapse but did not cause it </s>
<s> Pagan s disintegration was in fact more prolonged and unk </s>
<s> The kingdom had been in long gradual decline since the early century </s>
<s> Had Pagan possessed a stronger central government the collapse could have been temporary and the country could have risen again </s>
<s> But the dynasty could not recover and because the Mongols refused to fill the power vacuum no viable center emerged in the immediate aftermath </s>
<s> As a result several minor states fought it out for supremacy for the better part of the century </s>
<s> It was only in the late century that two relatively strong powers emerged in the unk basin restoring some semblance of normalcy </s>
<s> The vast region surrounding the unk valley would continue to be made up of several small Tai Shan states well into the century </s>
<s> Rise of Tai Shan states Perhaps the most enduring legacy of the unk invasions was the emergence of Tai Shan states in mainland Southeast Asia </s>
<s> The Tai Shan people who came down with the unk invasions stayed </s>
<s> By the early century several Tai Shan states had come to dominate a vast region from present day unk to northern and eastern unk to northern and central Thailand and Laos </s>
<s> Their rise was encouraged by the Mongols who viewed the states as a useful unk between unk and the rest of Southeast Asia </s>
<s> The Mongols who were still trying to incorporate unk into the central administration were unwilling or unable to make necessary sustained investments to bring the vast regions south of unk into the fold </s>
<s> The integration of unk itself into China unk was to take several more centuries and continues to today </s>
<s> As such from the newly formed Tai Shan states in western and central Southeast Asia to Dai Viet and unk in eastern Southeast Asia the Mongols elected to receive nominal tribute </s>
<s> Though the rulers of these states were technically governors of the Yuan government they were the native chieftains who would have ruled there in any case and they did as they pleased </s>
<s> unk of China on the unk border The war also marked the arrival of China at the unk of Burma </s>

<s> Mongolia unk relations During the official visit by the President unk unk to unk in November unk San Suu unk the unk of National League for Democracy said this was the first ever unk mission since the Mongols came years earlier </s>
<s> Battle of unk s Ridge The Battle of unk s Ridge also known as the Battle of the Bloody Ridge Battle of Raiders Ridge and Battle of the Ridge was a land battle of the Pacific campaign of World War II between Imperial Japanese Army and Allied mainly United States Marine Corps ground forces </s>
<s> It took place from September on unk in the Solomon Islands and was the second of three separate major Japanese ground offensives during the unk Campaign </s>
<s> In the battle US Marines under the overall command of US Major General Alexander unk repulsed an attack by the Japanese Infantry Brigade under the command of Japanese Major General unk unk </s>
<s> The Marines were defending the unk perimeter that guarded Henderson Field on unk which was captured from the Japanese by the Allies in landings on unk on August </s>
<s> unk s unit was sent to unk in response to the Allied landings with the mission of unk the airfield and driving the Allied forces from the island </s>
<s> unk the strength of Allied forces on unk about unk s soldiers conducted several nighttime frontal assaults on the US defenses </s>
<s> The main Japanese assault occurred around unk ridge south of Henderson Field manned by troops from several US Marine Corps units primarily troops from the unk and Parachute Battalions under US Marine Corps Lieutenant Colonel Merritt A </s>
<s> unk </s>
<s> Although the Marine defenses were almost overrun unk s attack was ultimately defeated with heavy losses for the Japanese </s>
<s> Because of the key participation by unk s unit in defending the ridge the ridge was commonly referred to as unk s ridge in historical accounts of the battle in Western sources </s>
<s> After unk s Ridge the Japanese continued to send troops to unk for further attempts to retake Henderson Field affecting Japanese offensive operations in other areas of the South Pacific </s>
<s> Background unk campaign On August Allied forces primarily US landed on unk unk and Florida Islands in the Solomon Islands </s>
<s> The landings on the islands were meant to deny their use by the Japanese as bases for threatening the supply routes between the US and Australia </s>
<s> They were also intended to secure the islands as starting points for a campaign to neutralize the major Japanese base at Rabaul and support the Allied New Guinea campaign </s>
<s> The landings initiated the six month long unk campaign </s>

<s> New Jersey Route Route is a state highway in the southern part of the US state of New Jersey </s>
<s> It runs </s>
<s> mi </s>
<s> km from an intersection with US Route US and the Garden State Parkway in Upper Township Cape May County to an intersection with US and County Route unk CR unk in unk Harbor City Atlantic County </s>
<s> The route which is mostly a two lane undivided road passes through mostly rural areas of Atlantic and Cape May counties as well as the communities of unk unk City unk Manor and Mays Landing </s>
<s> unk intersects several roads including Route in unk US in Mays Landing and US and the Atlantic City Expressway in Hamilton Township </s>
<s> The portion of current Route between unk and Petersburg received funding in to become a spur of the Ocean Highway </s>
<s> In what is now Route was designated a part of pre Route a route that was to run from Cape May to unk Harbor City </s>
<s> Route was designated onto its current alignment in replacing this portion of pre Route </s>
<s> In a freeway was proposed for Route running from the Garden State Parkway in Dennis Township to US in unk Township </s>
<s> This proposal was canceled by the mid due to financial and environmental concerns as well as lack of traffic </s>
<s> The interchange between Route and the Atlantic City Expressway was reconstructed into a full interchange with completion in June </s>
<s> Route description Route begins at an intersection with US in the unk section of Upper Township Cape May County heading to the north on a two lane undivided road </s>
<s> From the southern terminus a ramp provides access to and from the southbound Garden State Parkway </s>
<s> The road heads north through mostly rural wooded areas with some buildings </s>
<s> It intersects CR unk in unk before coming to a junction with CR unk </s>

<s> At this crossing the road runs closely parallel to a unk unk unk Operations railroad line before entering Petersburg where it splits from the railroad tracks and comes to a unk with CR </s>
<s> Upon leaving Petersburg Route turns to the north again and crosses over the unk unk unk Operations railroad line intersecting CR unk </s>
<s> It continues to unk and comes to CR unk </s>
<s> Past this intersection the route meets CR unk and CR unk </s>
<s> Route forms a concurrency with CR unk and the two routes head north and encounter the eastern terminus of Route before leaving unk </s>

<s> In unk City it heads into residential areas with CR unk unk to the west of the route </s>

<s> Major intersections Air Rhodesia Flight unk Air Rhodesia Flight unk was a scheduled passenger flight that was shot down by the Zimbabwe People s Revolutionary Army unk on September during the Rhodesian Bush War </s>
<s> The aircraft involved a Vickers Viscount named the unk was flying the last leg of Air Rhodesia s regular scheduled service from Victoria Falls to the capital Salisbury via the resort town of unk </s>
<s> Soon after Flight unk took off a group of unk guerrillas scored a direct hit on its starboard wing with a Soviet made unk surface to air infrared unk missile critically damaging the aircraft and forcing an emergency landing </s>
<s> An attempted belly landing in a cotton field just west of unk was unk by an unseen ditch which caused the plane to cartwheel and break up </s>
<s> Of the passengers and four crew died in this crash the insurgents then approached the wreckage rounded up the survivors they could see and massacred them with automatic gunfire </s>
<s> Three passengers survived by hiding in the surrounding bush while a further five lived because they had gone to look for water before the guerrillas arrived </s>
<s> unk leader Joshua unk publicly claimed responsibility for shooting down the unk in an interview with the BBC s Today programme the same evening saying the aircraft had been used for military purposes but denied that his men had killed survivors on the ground </s>
<s> The majority of unk both black and white saw the attack as an act of terrorism </s>

<s> Reports viewing the attack negatively appeared in international journals such as Time magazine but there was almost no acknowledgement of it by overseas governments much to the Rhodesian government s unk </s>

<s> On September Smith announced the extension of martial law over selected areas </s>

<s> The attack on unk in particular brought great controversy as many of those killed were refugees camping in and around guerrilla positions </s>
<s> Five months later in February unk shot down Air Rhodesia Flight unk another civilian flight in an almost identical incident </s>
<s> Background A dispute over the terms for the granting of full sovereignty to the self governing colony of Rhodesia or Southern Rhodesia led the colonial government headed by Prime Minister Ian Smith to unk declare independence from the United Kingdom on November </s>
<s> The idea of no independence before majority rule had recently gained ground in Britain and elsewhere amid decolonisation and Rhodesia s government was dominated by the country s white minority so the unilateral declaration went unk internationally </s>
<s> Britain and the United Nations imposed economic sanctions on Rhodesia </s>
<s> Two rival communist backed black nationalist groups initiated military campaigns to overthrow the government and introduce majority rule the Chinese aligned Zimbabwe African National Union unk mostly comprising unk created the Zimbabwe African National Liberation Army ZANLA and adopted aspects of unk doctrine while the unk dominated Zimbabwe African People s Union unk aligned with Soviet style unk unk and the Warsaw Pact mobilised the Zimbabwe People s Revolutionary Army unk </s>
<s> These guerrilla armies proceeded to wage what they called the Second unk against the Rhodesian government and security forces </s>
<s> The resulting conflict the Rhodesian Bush War began in earnest in December when ZANLA attacked unk and unk unk in north eastern Rhodesia </s>
<s> After the security forces mounted a successful counter insurgency campaign during and developments overseas caused the conflict s momentum to shift in the insurgents favour </s>
<s> The leftist Carnation Revolution of April caused Portugal to withdraw its key economic support for Smith s administration and led to Mozambique s independence the following year as a communist state openly allied with unk </s>
<s> Around the same time Rhodesia s other main unk South Africa adopted a unk initiative that forced a ceasefire giving the guerrillas time to regroup </s>
<s> Following the abortive Victoria Falls Conference of August Smith and the unk leader Joshua unk held unsuccessful talks between December and March </s>
<s> unk and unk announced in October during the run up to the unsuccessful Geneva Conference in December that they would unk attend conferences as a joint Patriotic Front </s>
<s> In March Smith and non militant nationalist groups headed by Bishop unk unk the Reverend unk unk and Chief Jeremiah unk agreed what became the Internal Settlement </s>
<s> This created a joint black white transitional government with the country due to be reconstituted as Zimbabwe Rhodesia in June pursuant to unk elections </s>
<s> unk and unk were invited to participate but refused unk unk dubbed Smith s black colleagues the blacksmiths </s>
<s> unk proclaimed to be The Year of the People as the war continued </s>
<s> Officials from unk s United African National Council sent to the provinces to explain the Internal Settlement to rural blacks were killed by Marxist unk guerrillas </s>
<s> unk also began to target Christian missionaries unk in the killing of nine British missionaries and four children at unk Mission near the Mozambican border on June </s>
<s> The transitional government was badly received abroad partly because the Internal Settlement kept control of law enforcement the military the judiciary and the civil service under white control </s>
<s> No country recognised Rhodesia s interim administration </s>
<s> Smith again worked to bring unk into the government hoping this would lend it some unk domestically prompt diplomatic recognition overseas and help the security forces defeat ZANLA </s>

<s> Incident Prior threats to Rhodesian air traffic Rhodesian air traffic was not seriously threatened until about in the latter stages of the war before this time neither revolutionary force had the weapons to launch a viable attack against an aerial target </s>
<s> The weapon that made such attacks feasible for unk was the unk shoulder launched surface to air missile launcher supplied by the Soviet Union from the mid as part of the Warsaw Pact s materiel support </s>
<s> By September there had been reported attempts to shoot down Rhodesian military aircraft using these weapons none of which had been successful </s>
<s> Some Rhodesian Air Force Dakotas had been hit but all had survived and landed safely </s>

<s> Flight Air Rhodesia was the country s national airline established by the government on September to succeed Central African Airways which was dissolved at the end of that year </s>
<s> Based at Salisbury Airport Air Rhodesia s flight network during the late comprised a domestic programme of passenger and cargo flights as well as international services to the South African cities of Johannesburg and Durban </s>
<s> The Flight unk aircraft was a Vickers Viscount unk a British made turboprop aircraft with two engines on each wing </s>
<s> It was named the unk after the river of the same name which flowed between Lake unk and the Rhodesian capital Salisbury </s>

<s> The flight took off from unk Airport on schedule soon after Central Africa Time </s>
